alert.note: Alert for Edgecombe (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 13 at 8:34PM EDT until April 15 at 11:25AM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Carolina... Tar River At Tarboro affecting Edgecombe County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and is forecast to continue. * WHERE...Tar River At Tarboro. * WHEN...Until late Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, The river is at bankfull. At 19.0 feet, Minor flooding begins. The Riverside Park and River Road at the US64 bridge flood. At 20.0 feet, Lowland flooding begins south of Daniel Street in east Tarboro. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 PM EDT Thursday the stage was 20.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:15 PM EDT Thursday was 20.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to crest between 20.2 and 20.3 feet tonight, fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening, and continue falling to 8.6 feet Tuesday evening. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 22.2 feet on 04/02/2010. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (8 pm EDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Mon Tar River Tarboro 19.0 20.2 Thu 7 pm EDT 19.4 16.7 13.7 10.8 &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rah/rivers. The next statement will be issued Friday morning by 830 AM EDT.
